item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 10th October
item.description:
Traffic lights Timings are incorrect With the bridge closed on Bamfurlong Lane, there is only one way out of Staverton Airport. At 5-5.00pm in Particular the timing on the lights where it meets the A4063 is crazy. It takes around 20-25 minutes to get across the junction . There is no other way out!!!
Report on FixMyStreet

A Missing/broken/rocking/unstable slab problem has been found by Gloucestershire County Council.., out side the shop Banners & Ballons, GL50 3LL Cheltenham, the paving is all broken up and full of weeds, become a major trip hazard, espesially on tghe dropped kerbs for wheelchair access

item.title: Bordered up at the eastern end of the footpath, 10th October
item.description:
I have a query about Cheltenham Footpath 1. I noticed this footpath was bordered up at the eastern end of the footpath along Old Gloucester Road. It also seems inaccessible along the field boundary that runs west along adjacent allotments. On the online PROW map it does not say the path is closed, so I am wondering if it is in fact closed and what it says on the definitive map.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A General road marking and stud issues problem has been found, 10th October
item.description:
Roundabout A40 to B4063, hatherley lane, road markings in middle lane from hatherly lane state A40 Glos chelt but the section leads to the B4063. and not chelt. the chelt section marking on the road needs to be revised.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Road markings on roundabout A40 gloucester road to hatherly lane, fiddlers green, 10th October
item.description:
From junction hatherly lane, road markings state centre lane is marked glos A40 and chelt, but as you emerge from lane, the lane markings guide you to the left which leads to the B4063/churchdown which caused obstruction and confusion for road users and possible collisions. road markings need to be changed so that the junction clearly states centre lane leads to B4063 and NOT chelt.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road markings Leckhampton, 10th October
item.description:
Dear Sir/Madam, Thank you for your notification of 15/9/23. I have some questions. First, how much clearance will you be allowing on either side of entrances? Is there a guideline on this that can be accessed and clearly understood? Or will decisions be left to the operatives on the day? I am concerned that new parking bay markings may have the effect of encouraging drivers to park closer to entrances than they actually do at present. This will have the effect of making it more difficult for drivers emerging from driveways on to the road, and thus more dangerous. There will be places where a decision has to be made whether a stretch of kerb is one space or two. I am afraid there may be some pressure to fit two in where there is hardly room for two. Second, what kind of 'minor kerb alterations' are envisaged? Third, are the parking bays intended to be in any way enforceable, or simply advisory? Fourth, has such a scheme been put into effect anywhere else in Cheltenham? By way of a comment, I am dubious about the scheme achieving any of its stated aims.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 144, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Tree too big, 9th October
item.description:
I live on Roselle Drive and there is a tree planted on the pavement about a foot from my garden wall. It is huge, much bigger than other trees nearby. It is overhanging my driveway, my garden and garden wall, and my wall joins are not looking very healthy. I would like to request it is pruned at least but I don’t want to have to pay since it is not my tree. Is this something you can help with? The tree itself is on Linden close as I live on the corner.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Linden Close, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Ash Tree located on Highway land
